Very nice craft market. Highly recommended to go here even if you aren't buying anything. Come here for sure if you are looking to buy some souvenirs to bring back home. They have a huge selection of hand crafts. Also they speak enough English there and they do not try to pressure you into buying things. Everyone at the market was very pleasant and fun to speak with. You can get by with limited spanish as well. The prices are reasonable as well.

We visited this market on a Monday morning and it was not crowded at all. Most of the vendors are very friendly and they don't pressure you to buy at all which is great! They can also speak sufficient English for a transaction. Helps to know a bit of Spanish for the numbers but that's not necessary. Would recommend this for souvenirs (ceramics, wooden Mexican crafts and textiles. Also - little colourful Jenga!)
Great place to see where locals buy goods and other things. Lots of fresh meat for sale. Also fried Scorpion 🤯 crocodile tacos and much more

Beautiful, old school Mexican restaurant.  We went for brunch and it was packed. Their tamales were the best I have ever tasted with the tamale with chicken and mole being the star.  I think the restaurant has been operating since early 20th century and the building is even much older.  They have a great kids menu, and lots of delicious baked goods that they bring right to your table.

Place was great! Mole was thick and sweet with a bit of spice at the end. For a person that doesn’t eat spicy, the salsa was perfect!!

(Eggs were perfectly fried, I broke the yolk before I took the pic)

Very nice food at reasonable prices. Was quite busy and had a large mariachi band playing music. Lots of fellow tourists there. If you don't speak Spanish you will be ok here. Menu in English and some staff speak English too. Overall very good.

The enchiladas Tacuba--in a poblano-spinach sauce--are worth the trip on their own! I've been coming here for years before and after the fire/restoration.  They did a fabulous job with the restoration.  The food is deliciously prepared and served. I love this place!!

The best cheese and veggie enchiladas I've ever had. The waiters are very accommodating and were eager to help with our dietary restriction. Beautiful decor inside with live music. We went two days in a row because of how much we loved it. Must go in Mexico City.
Historical place, beautiful and with great food! I really recommend this place as it brings a part of history as well as a very good mood. A little expensive but it worths it.

The servers speak only a little English, but we were able to manage. The cocktails and liquor selection is very good and afforable (70-90 pesos). The food was delicious. We had chipotle beef tips and the house fajitas. Also, you must see the interior. It is beautiful!
Our favorite bar in Mexico City. Fascinating history. Great service. Wonderful food. Memorable atmosphere. Beautiful live music.
Great historic Bar in the City Center! Affordable drinks, great service and above the average meals.
Amazing place to visit. It really takes you to the past and the food is also very good. And actually I feel bad rating it 3 stars but the bartender was if not rude very very serious.

First day in Mexico and left my credit card there, called the next day and they had it waiting for me. For that alone 10 stars. The candy is very tasty,  coco dorado was my favorite. It's not a tourist trap, you should definitely go!
Delicious and unique Mexican candy from a century or more old.

Overated, but it is a historical location. The surrounding shops and area has so much more to offer. The offerings at this store were overpriced and average in taste. Nothing was worth coming back for. Disappointing visit.
A family business since 1874! Great quality with a taste of Mexican history.
The staff doesn't seem super happy to help any of the customers, but the coconut filled like was delicious.
Overpriced and slow service
Wonderful staff and delicious treats!
Buen servicio, buenos platillos pero precios un poco elevados.
Excelente lugar muy buen servicio, mis felicitaciones al cheff
Excelente sashimi de jurel, recomendado.

Currently eating here right now. Really good Lebanese food, service is good, the manager greets you as soon as you get here. 
The restaurant is inside the building on the left side you gotta walk to the back and walk up the stairs to get here. 
Totally worth it.

I was first introduced to Lebanese food and El Ehden en 1961, and visited it frequently during my 25 years in Mexico. It was near the Zocalo, and I often introduced friends to it. The food is outstanding and prices reasonable. On a recent trip to the DF, went back taking my son and Mexican sis-in-law, who loved it as well. Wish it were closer! How I do miss it.
Food is excellent. I recommend the Lebanese platter a kind of different tates and flavors.
Very good food, it's a little hidden and it's on an area were you have to be careful, but the food and the pricing is really good, and the place is really pretty on the inside

This is the best Lebanese restaurant in Mexico, with a homemade flavor, it's like if I were at my grandma's house and she is cooking for me. It has a wonderful service, everybody is really kind, and they have a fast service and always perfect. Please if you are in downtown is a must.
Perfect if you want to eat really good Mexican food. Great atmosphere
Great service, and real old school mexican atmosphere. Definitely a place to check out to get a feeling of what Mexico is.

Definitely authentic atmosphere and frequented by locals. Rated it a 3 because the star of the show - Chile en nogada, was just average. It was overly sweet and the meat fulling was rubbery, not very flavorful.
It was also way too big for a single person. If you must order it (as I did, ignoring some reviews), share it and split a starter. You might have better luck with those!
Really nice Mexican restaurant a little bit expensive compare to other in the zone, great Chiles en nogada and mole
Total tourist trap from lonely planet recommendation, so sad and funny to see all the tourists with lonely planet books walking out disappointed.

Museum itself very nice but i will give 3 stars because there isnt any english explantation and if i visit history museum, i expect a route from century to century what happen in the country but after i visit history museum what i learn is nothing.
Beautiful castle, great views, but unfortunately the narrative is only in Spanish and there's no audio guide available
I recommend checking this place out for 2-3 hours. To get in they take your passport so just be forewarned.
Absolutely beautiful museum. Mainly people go to for the views of the city and the beautiful architecture of this historic mansion.
Great museum. Nice objects and great views of the city from its balconies. Unfortunately the boards are only in Spanish

This is the worst museum that I’ve ever visited. The exhibition is very limited. You only need 15 mins to finish everything. Except for lacking of works and exhibitions. The most disgusting thing to me is the lady who works at the lock room. I went to pick my backpack up. She was rolling her eyes to more than twice. She looked at my number and looked away. I said pickup again. She was moving slowly to get my backpack. I have no idea what does to her. But this service makes me very uncomfortable.

First time here and what a delightful experience. Architecturally talking the building is excellent. Clean lines with tons of different textures. On the other hand the work in there is quite appealing and relevant. Modern and contemporary art. One day of the week entry is free. Don't forget to check the restaurant upstairs because it is delicious!

FREE ON SUNDAYS! This Museum is located in a big, beautiful park (with a children’s play area), and there are many outdoor sculptures as well as incredible exhibitions inside. There are guided tours available during the week, and they’re closed on Mondays.
This place is cool when you aren't frying balls on acid.... but if that's a possibility, I wouldn't suggest against it.
It's one of those you just cannot miss. You'll love it.

Such an amazing experience! The zoo is giant and is free to everyone, it has so many animals!! There's many people selling food, toys, and souvenirs in the park! If you're visiting Mexico City I highly recommend coming to Chapultepec park and zoo, if you can I would recommend coming between Mon-Fri because it gets packed on the weekend...

This park is 100% FREEEEEEEE! YOU DONT NEED TO PAY ANYTHING TO GET IN. This place is very large with lots of things to do. You can go check out the animal exhibit that is completely free however backpacks and food is not allowed inside the animal park. There is also a castle you can check out very famous with lots of history and a lake with little pedal boats you can rent for cheap. Come see this beautiful place that is family friendly and has lots of things to do and see and of course, EAT.

GREAT VISIBILITY of many different animals, FREE, well kept, clean, pretty quiet also both times i was there.  The surrounding park area outside the zoo is expansive and beautiful and great for walking with your girlfriend/boyfriend or family.  Neat little shops in the surrounding area also in designated pathways.  Honestly, this "area" to include the surrounding area outside the park reminds me of Central Park in New York with it's massive size and beauty.  We walked past a small lake and rented a little boat for an hour.  Really, you can't go wrong with this.  Use the zoo as your destination for wandering around and then explore the surrounding area as well.  You'll hit it out of the park on this one!!!
Great free zoo. Beautiful shady zoo gardens with mostly modern habitats. Animals well cared for. Spent hours with school age kids.

We came towards the end of the day, and boy was it depressing. The zoo seems like it's on its way out. It was disappointing to find no lion and by the time we made it to the area with the tiger we weren't allowed to go in, despite the zoo not shutting for another 20mins. The enclosures didn't seem fantastic either. If you've got some spare time and are in the park, then it's maybe worth a visit. Otherwise you probably have a better zoo local to you in your own country.

This bookstore is located in what once was a cinema. The space is huge. There are sofas for reading, a café, a very good children’s books section, special events section, I particularly like the photography and art sections. If like books you can find a great selection of Latin American authors covering a wide range of subjects. However, Sometimes stock runs low, since this is a government enterprise, I suspect budget cut are probably to blame, but fortunately, this is not a frequent thing. The building is worth a visit.
Great library, there Is a little coffee inside but they Dont take credit carda, only cash, and a little movie theater. A great place for chilling
Great selection of books in Spanish. Extensive children's books section. Only in Spanish though. Beautiful space with a cafe.
Huge bookstore. It's well organized and well staffed. There are plenty of places to read and a little cafe too.
Great setup and excellent collection ..bought books on history  art and music
Great restaurant, tasty food and cocktails. Friendly staff that were accommodating to me and my friends not speaking much Spanish! Overall nice chilled ambience.

Very popular place, for good reason. They have a festive atmosphere and the food is well done across the board. Lots of fresh options and locally grown and sourced options. It is a bit more expensive, but caters to the well to do.

Not good for groups at all. Six of us... Instead of simply saying they had no space, they said it would be about 30mins. One hour later, no table, and the waiter explained it was hard to accommodate big groups due to the small table sizes. Food might be recommended but we never had the chance to find out!

Super overrated. Good atmosphere and excellent service. Probably a great spot to go out with a few friends for a dinner that's more drinking oriented. The food was quite lackluster overall but the ceviche was really good. We had way better tacos elsewhere.

Didn't like the fact that we got one bill for the row of people. Even though it was part of a group for a wedding. The sangria I ordered was so bad I returned it. Probably we still got charged for that and other things since they grouped a bunch of people's bill. The shrimps from our my order were so small and looked burnt.

With precise portions and perfect seasoning, it remains one of the best eateries in the neighborhood. It has a wide and tested selection of craft beers, both national and foreign, as well as coffee and chocolates grown by the peoples indigenous to the Chiapaneca region.

With a nice musical selection ranging from 80s New Wave to 21st Century Dark Wave, it's a place preferred and enjoyed by some of Mexico City's Goth population when looking for a bite and a drink while in the Roma neighborhood.

Highly recommend.

great to find a goth/alt bar with a decent range of drinks, tasty food, clean surroundings and friendly staff.  Wish we had places like this in London, I would happily return to CDMX just to visit Cafe Bizarro!
Priced are avg and coffee is ok, I didn't liked the entrances or the dip they served on my potatoes but meh... Service is great and for events are very open to groups.
Great live music and beer options.
Best night life in CDMX
Great flavors! Loved the hummus and keppe. Nice location. If you are looking for something traditional yet not boring here is great. Pet friendly
Good flavor, tasty and nice location, if you don’t have any idea what to order maybe you can start with some homemade hummus and try those stuffed zucchini

Nicely decorated restaurant with good service. 
I ordered a glass of house white which waiter said was Lebanese. Never had Lebanese wine or heard of it but happy to try. I then had starter (humus) and main that was meant to be sharwama but it was a different take...still nice thou. 
Wine wasn't that good it was somehow sweet and oak tasting. So I ordered spirit drink.
When bill came they charged almost 200 peso for glass of wine...that's over $12 for cheap Lebanese wine!!! It cost more than my main meal!! 
I saw owner in front and questioned him why he was charging sooo much for unbranded wine...he didn't speak English and my Spainish isn't great so waiter translate. Reason as far as I could understand was because "chef says". I told him i wasn't looking for discount but i have been to michelin star restaurants in Mexico that don't charge soo much for house wine and he should look into this.....ridiculous.
Every single dish was amazing!!! As good as it gets.
My first time trying libanese food, it was delicious. It seems a little expensive but it worth it.
Fun experience. Great service, food - and games on the table and for "check-out". Played battle ship and hangman w breakfast;-)
A nerve jangling pit of screaming. This is the circle of hell where children shriek constantly. Food was served slowly and had gone cold. Worst coffee I've had in Mexico. Waffles tasted stale. Avoid.
Great food and a lively atmosphere as they offer games you can check-out leaving your ID.

It's a good place to have fun with board games. They have a nice collection of games but be prepared to play the Spanish versions of them. The food is definitely over priced for the quality (chili dog and fries). The drinks taste great but you get a small sized drink for a large sized drink price. It has a great atmosphere but the wait staff seemed bored and at times hard to find. Definitely not one of my go to places but could be with a few modifications.
Really great place, food amazing, great service and just in front of the park
Salad bowl bar! I visited twice in a row. 110　pesos for the small bowl and it comes with healthy veg-fruit mix juice.

Always order from uber eats. Great salads! maybe a little on the pricey side, but they are worth it. Fresh, flavorful and they offered me free extra toppings one time they run out of ingredients. Mango dressing is my favorite! Recommended!
Kind staff. I do not speak Spanish. The staff taught me the Spanish names for the salad ingredients.

The place is always clean, sometimes the staff aren't in sight and take a long time to respond, but the food is good(a little expensive in my humble opinion), it's also a little cold inside the restaurant

reviews.author_name: P L A T A r q
reviews.text: Buen servicio. Buen lugar. Recomendado 100%
For the price it is a good deal, meats seem to be fresh and they are good to the palate.
Good quality meat

Excelentes ensaladas y su pastel especial delicioso! Excelente atención, los meseros atentos, educados y no molestan. Lo malo es que entran muchos vendedores callejeros y eso no ayuda a tener un momento agradable y tranquilo o sea una plática sin interrupciones.

Excelente lugar. Las empanadas, los cortes, las guarniciones, etc., todo de muy buena calidad, muy sabrosos y a precio razonable. El servicio es bueno. Recomiendo el filete a la pimienta y el vacío. Y no se vayan sin probar el pastel bariloche o el pastel de tres leches de café.

La comida es deliciosa sin embargo considero pertinente que coloquen un letrero que indique que NO cuentan con valet parking. El domingo pasado llegué y le di las llaves de mi auto a un señor quien me entregó un recibo enmicado.  Al salir del restaurante pregunté a uno de los meseros sobre el costo del servicio de valet y me indicó que no cuentan con ese servicio. Como podrán imaginar el susto fue mayusculo pues le di las llaves a un desconocido que no tiene ninguna relación comercial con Ustedes. Para mi fortuna  me entregaron el auto sin problema.
Inexpensive but presentation and quality is that of higher level restaurant.

Es un lugar acogedor para comer de manera sana y a buen precio, en los bordes de la colonia Roma, ofrece un rincón para sentarse solo o con buena compañía y disfrutar de la casual pero bien escogida gala de platos que ostenta. Su selección de vinos es ad hoc Al estilo que ofrece y los precios dejan satisfecha cualquier exigencia de precio y calidad.

Merece ser un lugar más conocido, sin embargo por ahora es conveniente ya que no tiene es que esperar por una mesa para una comida excelente.

En general me gustaron los precios, pues en otros lugares parecidos un platillo te cuesta 90 pesos, aquí te daban entrada, sopa, plato fuerte un café y un pequeño postre por esa cantidad. El menú no era muy variado pero estaba bien. Había cortes de carne, rollos de pechuga, enchiladas, milanesas, etc. La crema que me dieron estaba muy rica, y el plato fuerte también pero las guarniciones estaban más o menos. El lugar de veía bien de primera vista aunque ya viéndolo detenidamente se veía que estaba adaptado como restaurante pero el tipo de ambientación me gustó. Lo que sí no me gustó fue el baño que la verdad estaba muy feo y pequeño.

Agradable lugar, muy romántico y acogedor, sirven porciones muy bien servidas y bastante ricas, el precio es accesible y casi para todo tienen paquetes por un poco más de dinero, quedé fascinada, me recordó a los bares italianos
Buen servicio, buen ambiente, comida corrida dos dos, le falta sazón. No es barato. Eso sí te dan café y una chiqui rebanada de  pastel de postre.

Twas disappointed! After seeing some of the reviews I expected something special at the Jalapa 117, Roma location. While the tacos appear to be delicious, they weren't the best. In fact, they were fairly tasteless and lacked any character. The fish was bland and uninspired. It was unfortunate. Again, looks can be deceiving. The only redeeming taco was the soft shell crab.

Incredibly delicious seafood and fish- themed taco place. These were definitely some of the best tacos I've had in Mexico, and certainly my life. The flavors were complex yet unpretentious, and the staff was very sweet (even with a misunderstanding about the menu that was entirely my fault). Amazing. Can't wait to go back
I love everything I try here, specially "carnitas de pescado". Great burritos too.
Soft shell crab taco. So delicious!
Tasty but small portions
First house ever in Coyoacan
Historia y hoy una escuela de donde fue casa de la mística malitzin, una vez conquistado cortes Tenochtitlan y mudar residencia justo cerca de aqui, en centro de Coyoacán!
Una casa llena de historia y amor, hogar y taller de la gran artista Rina Lazo, amiga y colaboradora de Diego Rivera

Buen café, buena bevida y excelente atención. Gran variedad de té, café y deliciosos alimentos. Galletas, chocolates, insectos, ensaladas y todos sus puntos intermedios. Cuentan con café espresso y métodos alternativos como sifón japonés, V60, Chemex, etc. Ofrecen degustaciones de insectos, chocolates y café.
Bien

A great space for art lovers, and a must-do in mexico city. The space is great for taking pictures within lovely and colorful architecture, as well as getting to learn more about one of Mexico’s art icons and the history of the neighborhood’s scene in mid-XX century. If you get hungry during your visit, rest assured that the in-house coffee and restaurant has your back.

Very interesting museum even for people less interested in art. 
3 tips: 
1. Purchase tickets in the Internet. Otherwise the line may be very long. 
2. Take the audioguide. Definitely worth the extra money. Otherwise you will miss all the anecdotes and details. 
3. Taking photos requires extra payment....in principle😁

This is the house where Frida lived most of her life. It is beautiful and charming. I loved seeing her studio, the bedroom, the courtyard and imagining what it was like when she lived there. I recommend you purchase your tickets online so you don’t have to wait in line. We made the mistake of not paying the additional fee to take photos inside so unfortunately I have no photos of the inside.

A must while in Mexico city. 
Highly recommend that you buy your tickets ahead of time. 
The staff is extremely friendly and are super organized! This museum is well run for the amount of people they get daily!

Very nice. It is best to get an online ticket in advance, otherwise there is a long waiting line. Although this was a very relaxed waiting when I was there, the museum even handed out umbrellas for sun protection...
The building itself is part of the experience!

This small museum located very close to a speedway and is a source of historical facts for those who'd like a quick but exhaustive reminders on Trotsky Life in a general worldwide context. 
Efforts have been clearly put to preserve the house and its amenities: great glance into Trotsky "private Life. The garden is well preserved and is the perfect place to enjoy a coffee.
For 40 pesos (entrance fee), this museum is worth a visit! Don't forget to have a look at the drawing exhibition!

Not a lot of stuff is explained or written in English so it was hard to understand what was displayed. The outdoor courtyard was nice, tranquil, and relaxing. I could have been ok skipping this place.

You have to pay extra if you want to take photos. Didn't see anyone enforcing that, but it is a strange rule.

Historical. Interesting. There is a new café inside for a quick bite while you sit in the courtyard. My kids love the courtyard too because it's calming and beautiful. The house is beautiful and the photography and stories in the museum draw you in. The entrance fee is minor but the experience is impactful.
Super lovely and interesting.  It was neat to see where Trotsky lived during exile.  Too bad about the ice pick.
The place itself is beautiful. If you are into communism it would be meaningful too. The little cafeteria has good coffee and the temporal exhibitions (usually photography) are worth seeing.

This place is amazing for anyone who’s a watercolor enthusiast. The collection features different techniques and styles from mexican artists as well as international, that are a great inspiration and helps you discover more of what you can do with watercolors. The gardens are gorgeous too, and great for spending a little time sitting outside.
This place is absolutely amazing. We discovered it walking through Coyoacan streets and the value of it is indescribable. It is a must!

a tad small, not crowded, free entry (donations welcome of course) although you have to pay 50 pesos for a photography permit i think, the rooms dedicated to prehispanic and 19th century art are absolutely precious though small, the museum cafe is well-priced (amusing to see gangs of sparrows nibble tortilla crisps), there are also a few stone statues/sculptures around (based on prehispanic styles eg mayan) which are quite lovely as well
it definitely takes less than an hour to finish going through the museum, leaving you time to explore other museums in the area

personally i think watercolour is an expressive medium for depicting qualities of light and colour, such as the unfathomable gentleness of white-pink roses. it also lends itself to styles such as abstract art and cubism. 

overall worth a visit
One of the most beautiful and unknown museums in the city, a hidden jewel. It's free and it's hardly crowded.

A colorful house hosting beautiful acuarelas, temporary galleries, courses and events. A surprising place hidden in the limits of the old town of Coyoacan. A house of graphical creativity that drips living rainbows from static fabrics.

Really good bakery. Their cakes and pastries are very tasty. They offer savory options such as salads and sandwiches. Their drinks are great too. Service is fast, specially to go. However it is kind of overpriced. The venue is ok, small, but the inside is cozy. A good option in Coyoacan.
Great place for breakfast, they do an excellent huevos norteños. Seems to be open all day and sells very good artisan breads. Very busy on Sunday mornings but worth the wait!
Love this place! The tea, coffee, pastries, bread, everything is so good! And you can also drink a delicious mate 😍

Excellent breakfast, brunch place. Organic and healthy options available and not so healthy options available as well. Wide variety of pastries and smoothies. Lunch can be a healthy organic salad or a sandwich. Something for everyone. Popular place.
Get your coffee with cardamom. The chilaquiles are excellent, as are the parties.
I was actually kind of surprised about the pizzas... they are incredibly good. Beer is as cheap as I remembered. Good for catching up with old friends on a week night.
Fun little bar that was very nice to our kids, has about 20 different craft Mexican beers (bottled), some sandwiches and salads, and plays grunge.
Great place

Bizarro is appropriate for this weird little bar. The place isn't fancy, and shamelessly so. Eclectic, no frills horror/rock'n'roll decor and a good selection of beers. The upstairs is comfy, and going up/down the windy staircase is an adventure after a few drinks. Great place to chill and throw back some beers with friends and the super cool staff.
Great coffee. Not for wimps

Traditional Mexican dishes served bountifully, full of flavour and at an incredibly reasonable price.

The hand made tortillas alone, which are served as a courtesy, are good enough reason to visit. 

The "Enchiladas de Mole" are delicious, well portioned and made to order in a inquiry way (order them to find out how). 

Finally the Flan tasted like the ones made by my grandmother. I've not tasted one like that in over a decade.
Excellent traditional Mexican cooking. The fixed priced meals are a bargain.  Tidy and clean with efficient service.  This is a place where Mexican families go to eat Mexican food.
A beautiful place with mostly Mexican clientele and good food.  We love the tostada de mariscos.
Nice local place, blue tiles, an army of swarming waiters and a lady making fresh tortillas. Had the mixelote of veal which was lovely.
The food here is great.  I highly recommend the 'chiles en nogada'.  The sitting is a little cramped, so get there early.
Amazing food! Great service! Small in terms of space, though nicely optimized. Been many times. Always good experience.

Don’t go for the Sushi or Sashimi 🍣❌ 
It’s the worst I’ve had in a while, not fresh at all and tastes very “fishy”. The rice was undercooked, unseasoned, and still warm. Definitely overpriced as well. I don’t understand the good reviews at all (bots?!)
The fried chicken and shrimp and side dishes weren’t too bad but I still wouldn’t recommend the restaurant. You can get tastier, cheaper Japanese food in the area.

My first time eating here (had dinner) and the food was really tasty. It can get really busy (queue of people waiting to be seated) as it is very popular and the food is reasonably priced. Would have given 5 stars but the venue is small and a little uncomfortable trying to eat whilst there are a queue of people waiting in the wings for you to finish and leave lol
Not too expensive but good quality Japanese.  Famous for their Fried teriyaki chicken. The spice one is a must.
one of my favorite to go spots. great food at very reasonable prices... but mainly GREAT food. try the bento or the don squares. you will not be sorry. you WILL however, be very full.

The Virgin of Guadalupe is the Lady of Mexico and Mexicans are very much devoted to her. In every house, you find a little representation of the virgin. 

It is a very old church and they have maintain it properly. The monument itself is very beautiful. Because of how crowded it gets, they put an electric corridor so that people move/flow. 

In the back part of the church you will find a store with all kinds of religious gifts.

This Basilica is new compared to the temple next door, and they do have service plenty of times.  The place is big and it was finished being built in the 70's and it remains to look this way.  The place offers plenty of space to sit and stand. They have chapels in the second floor and plenty of doors to open the outdoors in.  
Here you can also visit the original image of the Virgin of Guadalupe.  
Pilgrimages are made to end at the basilica so if you visit, see the calendar of events so you may visit then or another time so you can avoid the large crowds.  Thousands of people visit this place.

The tilma (cloak) of St. Juan Diego is a scientific, historical and artistic marvel as well as a religious treasure. It will leave a deep and lasting impression on all who visit this basilica. Whether you are Catholic, Protestant, or come from another faith tradition, as you learn more about this artifact you will come to understand why 20 million people every year visit this place. And the faith of the people of Mexico will not fail to touch you as well. Very inspiring and uplifting.

What an interesting and historical site. Beautiful architecture of multiple periods, all decorated with the throngs of worshipers and activity.  If these walls could talk, what would they say?  I was surprised at the architecture of the old basilica, it seems to me sinking or isn't even when you walk through its interior.  I would say this was a highlight of our trip.

It's a local landmark and a must see if you're into religion or into history. The main church has masses all day and you can preview the Guadalupe Frame. Its a cool place to check out. You can be in and out within an hour. The coolest part is the climb in the nearby hill to view a part of the city.

We had a late valentines day dinner here and from the moment we stepped in we were impressed.   We didn't wait long to be seated and there was a server within mins to take care of us.  Our food was delicious and filling.  We ended up bringing a portion of our food home to enjoy at home.   The only thing that made it a 4star was the speed of the food once we ordered.  Given the fact it was very busy there were two other couples near us that came after us and were served their food before us.

I’ve loved this place for years. Hadn’t been in a few months, & was shocked at the price increases. 
$22 for a Ceasar salad at lunch? Food, service & atmosphere all great still, but I won’t be going here anymore. They’ve priced themselves out of my range.

The service was excellent - the servers were very attentive. The portions were large and the food was incredible!  Chef John came to our table and made our evening truly special.  We had the pasta special with mushroom soup to start, and the gorgonzola gnocchi with arugula salad to start. This is my favourite restaurant, hands down.

Visited Feb 28,2019  Food is great but went their on a Thursday at around 5:00pm. From the time we ordered and the time it came took 45 minutes.  It was the not the waitress as she made a joke about giving the cooks an evil eye and maybe they would take the hint.  Pasta dosen`t take that long to cook.  I also find the prices have jumped quite a bit. I don't think I will be returning.

Really great food. A wide variety of Italian specialties. Very good attentive service. Expensive though. One draw back: the restrooms are downstairs accessed only by a set of stairs. Well appointed but not overly accessible. Use your cane and take your time.

After getting to know them better, I eat at least once per month at Tokyo Japanese Restaurant. The service is absolutely impecable, the food is great, and the quality is constant. You never get bad sushi, bad soup, or soggy tempura. The awesome fish selection, availability of Japanese beverages and the care and dedication towards the food and the customer makes me want to go there again and again.

I've been visiting this restaurant every once in a while for years. Today the service and quality of the food were amazing, as always (I didn't realize I hadn't left a review until now). 

This is one of the (unfortunately) very rare places I know of in Cluj where I am confident I won't be let down when I return, and that's why I prefer Tokyo over other places for special moments.

I've become more and more appreciative of places that are able to offer the same great food and service constantly, irrespective of the time of year or how busy the restaurant is. 

I've been to Tokyo on quiet afternoons or on days when every table was booked and I noticed no difference in the experience - and that's just one of the things I love about this restaurant.

The food tastes amazing, in particular the seafood is well prepared and always fresh, and you can have sakuramochi for desert! 

The menu is varied and can offer a great experience of Japanese cuisine. It's even possible to order dishes consisting of smaller portions of various entrees and deserts, a really nice idea for those of us who have a hard time deciding what to order.

The staff are always ready to offer a smile and good advice, and they seem to know everything there is to know about the menu.

The atmosphere is intimate and quiet, with airy rooms that take your mind off the cluttered city, and the music is soothing and not too loud. I've noticed people tend to speak in hushed tones, and that can be a welcome change from the usual types of places where you need to raise your voice over the music and over the voices of people at other tables, but you do need to be in the mood for it.

There is more I could say about Tokyo, but it's probably better to visit them and discover for yourselves a place that strives to offer perfection in the smallest details, and, at least in my opinion, achieves it.

Thank you for a wonderful evening and for the care and attention to details you always spoil us with.

It was my first time for my friends and me in this restaurant. The service is amazing. You are being greeted by everyone with a nice smile. The woman at the reception kindly took our luggages and kept for the time being there.
The waitress was also very polite and helped us with the menu. She also knew what dishes were vegan and/or gluten-free. 
The food was very very good and we didn't wait so long for it.
If I am ever going back to Cluj, I will definitely go back to this restaurant!

Awesome food and service. The person who served us was very nice and hospitable.
I find the design of the restaurant quite boring.

Taste and quality of the Sushi was really nice. The service very welcoming and discrete.
Only thing I would recommend is to improve the presentation and arrangement of the food
